009package Ch21_Geometric_Operations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.image.ImageGraphics;
015
016import java.awt.Font;
017import java.awt.Graphics2D;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This ImageJ plugin draws a test grid in a new image. It uses anti-aliased drawing operations provided by
022 * imagingbook's {@link ImageGraphics} class. Used in [1] for testing geometric transformations (see Fig. 21.6) and
023 * interpolation methods (see Fig. 22.25).
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
027 * (2022).
028 * </p>
029 *
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/11/28
032 * @see ImageGraphics
033 */
034public class Draw_Test_Grid implements PlugIn {
035        
036        private static int W = 400;
037        private static int H = 400;
038        private static int xStep = 20;
039        private static int yStep = 20;
040        private static int xStart = 100;
041        private static int yStart = 100;
042        private static int xN = 10;
043        private static int yN = 10;
044        
045        private static int foreground = 0;
046        private static int background = 255;
047        
048    @Override
049        public void run(String arg) {
050        ByteProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(W, H);
051        ip.setValue(background);
052        ip.fill();
053        
054        try (ImageGraphics ig = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
055                        ig.setColor(foreground);
056                        ig.setLineWidth(1.0);
057                        
058                        int y = yStart;
059                int x1 = xStart;
060                int x2 = xStart + xN * xStep;
061                        for (int j = 0; j <= yN; j++) {
062                                ig.drawLine(x1, y, x2, y);
063                                y = y + yStep;
064                        }
065                        
066                        int x = xStart;
067                        int y1 = yStart;
068                        int y2 = yStart + yN * yStep;
069                        for (int i = 0; i <= xN; i++) {
070                                ig.drawLine(x, y1, x, y2);
071                                x = x + xStep;
072                        }
073                        
074                        ig.drawLine(0, 0, W - 1, H - 1);
075                        ig.drawOval(xStart, yStart, W/2, H/2);
076                        
077                        Graphics2D g = ig.getGraphics2D();
078                        g.setFont(new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 18));
079                        float xLeft = 8;
080                        float yTop  = 19;
081                        float xRight = W - 17;
082                        float yBot  = H - 10;
083                        g.drawString("1", xLeft, yTop);
084                        g.drawString("2", xRight, yTop);
085                        g.drawString("3", xRight, yBot);
086                        g.drawString("4", xLeft, yBot);
087        }
088        
089        new ImagePlus("Grid",ip).show();
090    }
091}
